messages.message: I think this issue came up before - is there a way to force the model in Build to only return its answer in a numerical value? No matter what I try - complex queries, ordinary ones, asking for 'exactly this', or "return only the amount" - in many cases it still returns "the total amount is $5,600" instead of just "5,600". These are fairly straightforward invoices
This is the link (https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1e6Sbz8B_iqOL0ku1ByfIo1g4XbovhGnf?usp=sharing) to a folder with the underlying invoices
I have given up after attempt 1000 :joy:

I have the same question for Docs. Given the prompt "What is the Description associated with the largest debit?" I get the response:

> The Description associated with the largest debit is "BART-CLIPPER M".
Why not just return the part in quotes?
Using refiner you can trim the answer using regex
That makes sense @Dale DeLoy and shows the immense value of refiner. A simplified way to enable this for no code AI Hub users would be super powerful
“Are you expecting just numbers or string”, “you seem to extract monetary values - do you want to include a currency denomination?” Etc
I just removed everything that was not a number  or decimal
Also, you could remove the words if they are consistent enough so you get the extracted value in its format

Interesting, I’ll also try! Thanks for the feedback, @Bas 

@lydia @Bastiane this is consistent with feedback we have received earlier on how LLMs aren’t able to return the exact output format in many cases
